verses.roman:
āmi yaiche paraspara viruddha-dharmāśraya
rādhā-prema taiche sadā viruddha-dharma-maya

synonyms: āmi—I; yaiche—just as; paraspara—mutually; viruddha-dharma—of conflicting characteristics; āśraya—the abode; rādhā-prema—the love of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī; taiche—just so; sadā—always; viruddha-dharma-maya—consists of conflicting characteristics.
translation: "Just as I am the abode of all mutually contradictory characteristics, so Rādhā's love is always full of similar contradictions.
